comments.body:
> 

To avoid confusion, I think @maxkadel is referring to the traject log errors referencing rare locations that are not in bibdata because they are in an experimenting stage in the alma sandbox. The records that have holdings in these locations will not get indexed. I'm assuming some of the mmsids that @maxkadel is referencing for testing are in these locations so don't expect to see them getting indexed in catalog-staging.

> Disregard any location issues - it's an unrelated issue with experimenting with rare book locations in the Alma sandbox.

To avoid confusion, I think @maxkadel is referring to the traject log errors referencing rare locations that are not in bibdata because they are in an experimenting stage in the alma sandbox. The records that have holdings in these locations will not get indexed. I'm assuming some of the mmsids that @maxkadel is referencing for testing are in these locations so don't expect to see them getting indexed in catalog-staging.
Some of the locations are also displaying strangely, which I believe is because of the locations experimentation as well, rather than this code.

Alma Affliate patron groups should only be able to use certain request types

comments.body: From the 9/14 Circ meeting: the GST Guest Patron patron group (code GST) should also be included in groups that have these limited request options.
These 3 patron groups should also be able to request Marquand off-site materials.

These restrictions/abilities should not depend on how the user logs in (alma login vs CAS).  There is a mix of login types within these patron groups.

Patrons may change their patron group throughout the year (for example, if a staff member retires).

pdc_describe.title: When a work has an existing DOI, redirect it

comments.body:
I did some testing of updating with items in our DOI prefix and items not in our DOI prefix (most if not all of the PPPL DOIs).  We do not have permission to update the DOIs with a new URL in a prefix that we do not own.

I saw responses like 
```
You are not authorized to access this resource
```

> I did some testing of updating with items in our DOI prefix and items not in our DOI prefix (most if not all of the PPPL DOIs). We do not have permission to update the DOIs with a new URL in a prefix that we do not own.
> 
> I saw responses like
> 
> ```
> You are not authorized to access this resource
> ```

I'm not surprised. It may be best to use the DOI prefix (`10.?????/`) in your logical statement before doing so.
Related to #3292.

princeton_ansible.title: get a 303 redirect to the new pemm website

comments.body: Current failure is `"AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ vault_ojs_site_adminname }}: 'vault_ojs_site_adminname' is undefined"`. But I've looked in group_vars and that vault variable does exist. Do we need to load the group_vars explicitly?

Note for Future Us: the problem turned out to be that the default variables in the role were pointing to the vaulted variables. We do not decrypt vaulted variables in CI, so the tests were failing because some variables were not defined. The solution here was to provide fake values in the role's `defaults/main.yml` file for use in CI. The playbook pulls in `group_vars` and those files point to the vaulted variables. See, for example, [this line](https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/blob/d5bb4fc6bb44047502062cb65e154b443136cfa8/group_vars/ojs/main.yml#L22).

pulfalight.title: Show Online content icons on search results page
create an LCSH masking mechanism as in "Change the Subject"

comments.body:
Here's how it's done in orangelight:
https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/7c3e63c479ac2f9c8a59b53cfdbe878763ecf5bf/marc_to_solr/lib/traject_config.rb#L810-L832

And the support class:
https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/38405f611eccbdcc703b68ca91f4f0b79a7dd08e/marc_to_solr/lib/change_the_subject.rb

The config file (also linked above) is yaml:
https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/6630d8cadbfb8acd8a34aff7664e8821acb313d6/marc_to_solr/lib/change_the_subject/change_the_subject.yml

Proposed implementation:
- [ ] Do pulibrary/bibdata#1994
- [ ] decide on a new field where we'll store the archaic / replaced terms
- [ ] indexing test to make sure new field gets populated
- [ ] indexing test to make sure archaic terms are no longer included in field that's displayed, and replacement terms are included
- [ ] search test to make sure the result still comes up when the archaic term is used.

The relevant field in pulfalight is called `subject_terms_ssim`

There's also a field called `access_subjects_ssim` which comes from upstream arclight. I don't think this field is relevant here but I'm not sure what it is exactly. Related arclight issues / PRs:
- https://github.com/projectblacklight/arclight/issues/469
- https://github.com/projectblacklight/arclight/pull/593

pulfalight.title: yellow log-in box should always appear for components with OARSC content
Collections should display text date, not normalized value
Display ranges for consecutively-numbered containers with AbIDs
Search results when a name is selected from the Names facet are confusing/duplicative
Figgy should synchronize finding aid data that hasn't yet been published in aspace

comments.body:
New plan:

- Undo the indexing rules introduced in #1032 and #1037 (keep the token auth stuff)
- Update the jsonld endpoint to
   - if there's an entry in the index, present it
   - else if the token is good, ask aspace for the title of the collection or component
   - present a very bare-bones jsonld record (possibly just the title, start with that)

This should be enough to get objects started in figgy, without having to fuss over unpublished fields. As soon as the record is published and indexed in pulfalight, figgy will get the updated metadata.

pulfalight.title: Generate wireframes for improving discoverability of online content

comments.body: Here is a fairly complete [set of wireframes](https://xd.adobe.com/view/1a8defd5-0cd8-4715-a5c1-9cb7795d2ece-4fde/) based on everyone's feedback. I added icons to parents of online content that are grey in color to distinguish. Only the green icons actually have online content. Questions/comments can be input directly to the prototype, or dropped here.
